intro: Agathosma wrightii, commonly known as Wright's agathosma, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky environments and has aromatic, glandular leaves. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
